newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * Winter energy reserves are higher this year than in any of the previous four years, head of Renel electricity authority Victor Romert, told a news conference. He said energy shortages might occur, due to regional factors.
* Romert said Renel was expecting a rise in electricity prices next year, in line with Romania's committments to international lenders, but he did not elaborate.
* Incumbent President Ion Iliescu met representatives of pensioners' organisations and visited a home for the elderly, on his campaign for Sunday's presidential run-offs.

* Three major unions -- Miners' confederation, education confederation and railmen unions -- pledged support to opposition candidate Emil Constantinescu at Sunday's vote. The three unions have an electoral accord with former prime minister Petre Roman's social Democrats.
* Romanian radio allotted 45 minutes of air time for Iliescu's and Constantinescu's electoral campaigns. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
